Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Elcot Avenue, Peckham, London

item.title: Lower growth of large lime tree blocking pavement, 2nd July
item.description:
Tree growth is blocking the pavement at the junction of Chislehurst Road and Cambray Road, such that parents with children or a buggy have to step onto the road. Also, it's in close proximity to Ballater GP surgery so there's a high footfall on this pavement. Thank you for your attention to this - it will be much appreciated

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambray Road, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trash all down the street, 2nd July
item.description:
Can a team come and pick up all the litter and trash on Elcot Avenue? I mean actually get everything that's between the parked cars and that pathways where it's been left to gather for months. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Elcot Avenue, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly-tipping and overflowing bins on Southwold road, 2nd July
item.description:
The constant and long-term fly-tipping on Southwold road poses a real sanitary issue. The bins are not emptied often enough, on top of non-residents leaving their rubbish in front of our bins. A long-term solution would be much appreciated.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow double lines needed, 2nd July
item.description:
Abbey Trading Estate, entrance to the side of Bell Green. Double yellow lines needed. The garage (Sydenham MOT) park all the vehicles in their care up on the kerb/main road, if you try to pull out from the estate, your vision is totally blocked from vehicles coming from Bell Green.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bell Green Lane, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Dangerous bollards and Waste of tax payer money, 2nd July
item.description:
Three wooden bollards were unnecessary and poorly installed and keep falling over. The council keeps sending people to fix them and within 2 weeks they've fallen over again. They also pose a danger to HGVs making deliveries as they can no longer turn properly into the close. Please stop wasting the money I pay in taxes and just remove them. We do not need or want them here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped toilet bowl and cistern, 2nd July
item.description:
Dumped toilet bowl and cistern outside the old Chatsworth Tyre Shop on Lockhurst St, E5
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sewdley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More and more rubbish … nothing changes!, 2nd July
item.description:
More rubbish and fly tipping at the same spot this morning, as usual! The council cleaned the area just yesterday and this is the scene this morning. This is a DAILY problem as I’ve reported several times without any effective action by the council to investigate the root causes and find solutions to tackle the issue. Just cleaning is not the answer and this is a problem the occurs EVERY DAY. Often the rubbish is all over the pavement for days! It’s becoming a public health issue in the area. Please, be considerate with the residents of the area and take proper action, Greenwich Council. It’s frustrating!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Osborn Terrace, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please do something about this corner, 2nd July
item.description:
The rubbish is dumped by people who don’t live on our street. Much of it comes from residents of Kenworthy Road. They need to be visited and told that flytipping is a criminal offence.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenworthy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
